articles.title: T-Mobile CEO: Tariffs on phones will have to be eaten by consumers
articles.content: T-Mobile CEO Mike Sievert weighs in on tariffs and his company's outlook amid a global trade war.

articles.title: Apple to Strip Secret Robotics Unit From AI Chief Weeks After Moving Siri
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. will remove its secret robotics unit from the command of its artificial intelligence chief, the latest shake-up in response to the company’s AI struggles.Most Read from BloombergTrump Gives New York ‘One Last Chance’ to End Congestion FeeWhy Car YouTuber Matt Farah Is Fighting for Walkable CitiesBackyard Micro-Flats Aim to Ease South Africa’s Housing CrisisThe Racial Wealth Gap Is Not Just About MoneyTo Fuel Affordable Housing, This Innovation Fund Targets Predevelopmen

articles.title: Apple Gets a Reality Check: BofA Slashes Price Target on Tariff and AI Setbacks
articles.content: Bank of America cut its Apple stock price target by $10 to $240, citing tariff costs and AI delays.

articles.title: Alphabet Q1: Excellent Results, Strong Buy
articles.content: Alphabet Inc. beat Q1 estimates with 12% revenue, 49% EPS growth. Google's new $70 billion share repurchase authorization is a key plus. Click for my GOOGL update.

articles.title: Apple to boost iPhone production in India by 10% this year
articles.content: Investing.com -- Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) plans to increase iPhone production in India by around 10% in 2025, The Information reported citing a person involved in the company’s supply chain.

articles.title: Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) Enables Seamless Philz Coffee Orders With App Clips Integration
articles.content: Philz Coffee recently announced the integration of App Clips to improve digital ordering, with features like seamless Apple Pay transactions, across select U.S. locations—an indication of how companies are leveraging technology for enhanced customer experiences. In the past week, Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) shares rose 3.87%, a figure that aligns with the overall trend of tech stocks climbing as investors digested a series of optimistic earnings reports and awaited tariff news. Apple's performance...

articles.title: Strong Earnings for Apple Could Precede a Tariff Pummeling
articles.content: Apple  could report strong growth in quarterly sale as buyers try to avoid tariff-related price increases, but investors should remember the iPhone maker has a difficult couple of months ahead.  Apple is not only the largest company in the U.S. by market capitalization, it is among the leading tech businesses most likely to be directly hurt by President Donald Trump’s tariffs.  While Trump has placed heavy levies on Chinese imports, he has temporarily halted those on personal electronics like smartphones.

articles.title: EU Hits Apple and Meta With $684 Million in Fines Over Tech Rules
articles.content: Apple and Meta fined $684 million total for breaching new EU tech law.

articles.title: How Google Provides A Better Short Option Than Other Mag 7 Stocks
articles.content: Google stock currently stands as a better short opportunity than some of the other Magnificent Seven companies like Apple or Microsoft.
